titleStmt.title: The hearse of the renowned, the Right Honourable Robert Earle of Essex and Ewe, Viscount Hereford, Lord Ferrers of Chartley, Bourchier and Lovaine, sometime Captaine Lord Generall of the armies raised for the defence of King and Parliament As it was represented in a sermon, preached in the Abbey Church at Westminster, at the magnificent solemnity of his funerall, Octob. 22. 1646. By Richard Vines. Published by order of the House of Peeres.
titleStmt.author: Vines, Richard, 1600?-1656.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T.R. and E.M. for Abel Roper at the sign of the Sun against Dunstans Church in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A sermon preached at the funerall of the Right Honourable Robert Earle of Essex, &c.
Probably the second edition (Wing V554 and V554A, variants of each other, constitute the probable first). Quire A is in the same setting in all, with the imprint altered.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary, New York.

place.placeName: the sign of the Sun against Dunstans Church in Fleet-street
